node.title: More flooding in Wairoa leads to residents being evacuated
node.description: Flooding is occurring again around Wairoa and some residents in the northern Hawke's Bay town have now been evacuated.

node.title: PM says Solomon Islands developing relationship with China 'gravely concerning'
node.description: Jacinda Ardern says there is "very little" reason for China to station military forces on the Solomon Islands, describing developments as "gravely concerning". Audio

node.title: Abramovich, Ukrainian peace negotiators hit by suspected poisoning - reports
node.description: Russian billionaire Roman Abramovich and the negotiators showed symptoms that included red eyes, constant and painful tearing, and peeling skin on their faces and hands, according to a Wall Streetâ€¦

node.title: Fears high building costs will leave home owners under-insured
node.description: The rising cost of building materials may leave home owners nationwide in the lurch as the risk of under-insurance grows.

node.title: Auckland CBD outlets hope for return of office-goers, tourists
node.description: Two years into the pandemic, dozens of shops remain empty on the main street and foot traffic to the CBD is still less than half what it was in 2019. Audio

node.title: Missing Auckland man found dead near Manukau Heads
node.description: The body of missing Weymouth man Nick Paul has been located at Orua Bay near Manukau Heads, police say.

node.title: Tramper missing in Fiordland with search underway
node.description: A tramper who is missing in Fiordland was reported overdue early yesterday.

node.title: 'Coup in search of a legal theory': US judge rules Trump likely committed felony
node.description: A US judge ruled that former President Donald Trump "more likely than not" committed a felony by trying to pressure his vice president to obstruct Congress and overturn his election defeat.

node.title: Taylor happy with retirement decision
node.description: The veteran Black Cap Ross Taylor knows he's made the right decision to call time on his 15 year international cricket career.

node.title: House January 6 committee refers contempt charges for Navarro and Scavino
node.description: "In short: these two men played key roles in the ex-President's efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 election," committee chair Bennie Thompson said in a statement.

node.title: Tactix dominate second half to down Magic
node.description: The Tactix turned in an impressive second half to beat the Waikato Bay of Plenty Magic 61-54 in their ANZ Netball Premiership game in Tauranga.

node.title: On the farm - a wrap of farming conditions around NZ
node.description: Country Life - Stock feed is being squelched into the ground on the East Coast after downpours this week, while in dry South Otago, some dairy farmers are thinking of drying off early.

node.title: One dead after cyclist and vehicle crash in south Taranaki
node.description: A person has died in a crash between a vehicle and a cyclist in south Taranaki on Tuesday morning.

node.title: China-Solomons deal cause for serious concern - Peters
node.description: Former Minister of Foreign Affairs Winston Peters has accused the government of neglecting the Pacific and says his successor should have visited the region sooner.

node.title: School attendances plummet as pupils affected by Omicron surge
node.description: More than 200,000 children have been staying home from school every day this month during the Omicron surge.

node.title: Depleted scallop fisheries in upper North Island to close after drop in numbers
node.description: Depleted scallop fisheries in Northland, most of Coromandel and the Hauraki Gulf are to be closed to allow them time to recover.

node.title: Will Smith apologizes for slapping Chris Rock at the Oscars
node.description: "I would like to publicly apologize to you, Chris," Smith wrote on social media. "I was out of line and I was wrong,"

node.title: CBS News crew visits "liberated" Ukrainian town
node.description: A CBS News crew on its way to Makariv was told to take cover as alleged Russian drones flew overhead.

node.title: Small to medium exporters could feel pinch of disruptions as Covid-19 surges in China
node.description: The export sector is keeping a close watch on potential disruptions as China clamps down on a resurgence of Covid-19.

node.title: 'Massive problem': Almost 500 children, teens in OT care harmed in 2020-21
node.description: Children are being harmed at an increasing rate while in the care of Oranga Tamariki. Audio

node.title: U.S. expands COVID vaccinations of migrants in border custody
node.description: The policy change comes as officials wait for a CDC announcement on the future of Title 42, which has allowed the U.S. to quickly expel migrants during the pandemic.

node.title: Millions of women in U.S. lack access to maternity care
node.description: In Texas, fewer than half of rural hospitals deliver babies.

node.title: Florida officials confiscate 75 guns amid spring break surge
node.description: Panama City Beach's police chief admonished the crowds gathered for spring break after a 21-year-old from Alabama was shot in the foot on Sunday.

node.title: China has more gold kiwifruit vines than NZ - but none of it is legal
node.description: Illegal plantings of New Zealand's gold kiwifruit in China are continuing to soar and it's thought that country now has more gold vines than New Zealand.

node.title: What does a Best Picture win for "CODA" mean for Apple TV+?
node.description: Apple's historic win is expected to add 10 million subscribers to its streaming service's base of customers.

node.title: 500 pound black bear living near Tennessee college relocated national forest
node.description: The bear, nicknamed Big Bruin, was safely released to a "remote area" of the Cherokee National Forest some 40 miles away from the school.

node.title: FedEx CEO Fred Smith to step down in June
node.description: Smith founded FedEx in 1971 and led it for over 50 years as it grew into a $60 billion shipping giant.

node.title: Marlborough Sounds salmon dying after hot summer
node.description: Environmental watchdog group Guardians of the Sounds has obtained figures showing New Zealand King Salmon dumped close to 1300 tonnes of fish waste in landfill over the last three months.

node.title: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky insists on territorial integrity as talks loom
node.description: The Ukrainian president has insisted on the territorial integrity of his country, after earlier suggesting Ukraine was willing to assume neutral status and compromise over the status of Donbas.

node.title: Student halls of residence under scrutiny as new rules kick in
node.description: As the academic year gets under way, new rules to support students in halls of residence are being closely monitored.
